idioms.meaning: to hold one's breath (in fear, anxiety, etc.)
to harm oneself as a result of trying to harm someone else
to keep one's wit about one

idioms.word: 天に向かって唾を吐く
idioms.reading: てんにむかってつばきをはく
idioms.meaning: to harm oneself as a result of trying to harm someone else

idioms.reading: てんをあおぎてつばきす
idioms.meaning: to harm oneself as a result of trying to harm someone else
to keep one's wits about one
words once spoken cannot be taken back

lessons.japanese: シンガポールでは、地面に唾を吐くことは犯罪です。
lessons.indonesian: In Singapore, it is a crime to spit on the ground.

lessons.japanese: 考えただけで虫唾が走るわ。
lessons.indonesian: That makes me disgusted just to think of it.

lessons.japanese: 彼はそのドラマを固唾を飲んで見つめた。
lessons.indonesian: He watched the drama holding his breath.

lessons.japanese: 彼の唾の吐き方が我慢できない。
lessons.indonesian: I can't put up with the way he spits.
A word, once out, flies everywhere.
My mouth forms a lot of saliva.

lessons.japanese: 私は興奮して固唾をのんだ。
lessons.indonesian: I held my breath in excitement.

lessons.japanese: シンガポールでは道路に唾を吐くのは犯罪です。
lessons.indonesian: Spitting on streets is a crime in Singapore.

lessons.japanese: 私は興奮して固唾をのんだ。
lessons.indonesian: I held my breath in excitement.
My mouth forms a lot of saliva.
A word, once out, flies everywhere.
